result.execSummary:
Devonta Levear Spencer was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Devonta Levear Spencer was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonta Levear Spencer

records.addlTxt: Per Corpal Gahan Defendant has been extradited.

Case called at 1:40 pm. State appears by District Attorney Adam Gerol. Defendant appears in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail with Atty. Rachel Boaz appearing for Atty. Heather Dvoran. Corporal Dan Gahan sworn and testified. Defendant waives extradition to Minnesota. Court sets Review Hearing before Judge Cain on 4/5 at 10:00 am.

10:47 AM Cases called: 22CM16/22CF15 Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Devonta Levear Spencer appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Heather Dvoran appeared in court for Devonta Levear Spencer. Counsel advises Corp Gahan continuing to work with Minnesota on extradition.
Review hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing on March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:28 PM Defendant Devonta Levear Spencer in court, in custody.  Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court examines Defendant on right to Counsel. Defendant requests representation of PD.  Attorney Boaz now appears via video. Testimony of Corp Gahan. Complaint sworn and signed. Counsel advises Defendant is waiving extradition and request reasonable bond for Defendant to post and turn self in on warrant. Court examines Defendant on waiver of extradition, Defendant does not waive extradition. Counsel requests date for attorney Dvoran to meet with Defendant. State requests Defendant held without bail. Court signs fugitive warrant.  Hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
